p: There are at least several reasons for optimism. First of all, epidemiological surveillance and “first lines of defence” are currently in place throughout the European Union. If they work well in most countries, it is possible that their outbreaks will be controlled and would not enter a phase of exponential growth in the number of infected cases. In the most favourable scenario, with this retention, this novel coronavirus would show seasonality. Then, it would gradually disappear from circulation among humans with changes in nature characteristic of late spring and summer [ 3]. However, this is the most favourable scenario, in which the final death toll would be much lower than that already caused by the flu this year.
